title: Bank of America log in problem
content:
Almost every time I try to log into Bank of America with Firefox desktop, the login is unsuccessful, and the blank login page is displayed again. Again I fill out my User ID and password and press Log In. Usually the same result: the blank log in page reappears, and I try again. Once in a blue moon, the log in is successful, maybe once in 20 attempts. I am using the latest version of Firefox.

I just tried logging in with MS Edge. I successfully logged in on the first try!

title: Browser having trouble functioning
content:
Hey guys,

I really enjoy using Zen, but whenever there's a new update, the browser seems to start up from the beginning, as in, my laptop has to confirm again if I want it to be my standard browser, the shortcuts that I'd made don't work anymore (cmd+T now pops up the search bar instead of opening a new tab, while my settings say that this shortcut is supposed to open a new tab). It has just happened often that whenever there's a new update the browser seems to be very confused, it doesn't seamlessly just blend the new updates into my already existing preferences. A while back (like 3 months ish?) you guys had a new update and I had to go through the whole thing of installation again of the browser, I had to choose if I wanted to import data from an old browser while I had already set Zen up way before, plus I had to choose the dark mode/colour preferences and all that stuff.

I really enjoy this browser when nothing is going wrong but there's so many stuff changing often and not blending seamlessly that it really messes with the user experience.

Hope this feedback is somewhat useful,

Best, Sophia
creator: visueleprikkel

title: Easy Method to Convert MSG to PDF.
content: Using a dependable and effective third-party program, such as MacProTools MSG to PDF Converter, is the most effective way to convert MSG to PDF in bulk. You can save time and effort by using this software to convert several MSG files to PDF format at once. Even inexperienced users can easily complete the conversion process because to its intuitive UI. To ensure that no data is lost or changed, the application maintains the original MSG files' metadata, folder structure, email formatting, and attachments throughout the conversion process. For greater customization, it also provides a number of sophisticated features like date range filters and selective conversion choices. This practical solution offers a hassle-free method of bulk MSG to PDF conversion without sacrificing performance or quality.

title: Allow 3rd party session cookies for Kaltura
content: I cannot figure this out, it was working around 10 minutes ago and now it's not. I use canvas for school and within that is Kaltura, used for uploading and recording lectures etc. I'm now being hit with the "It seems your browser is blocking 3rd party session cookies which are required for the Kaltura application. To resolve this issue, please update your settings to allow 3rd party cookies." and nothing I do seems to fix it. My settings are set to standard, didn't work. I tried to allow an exception but since it's embedded within the school canvas, I don't know how to get the Kaltura URL and the normal canvas url doesn't bypass it. I've went to the about:config and messed around with that based on other support posts, but that didn't work either. I went into the cookie setting and set it to custom and just unchecked the cookies, but that still didn't work. I'm at a complete loss and I need some help.
